title: [BEAM-11407] Add IT tests to Bigtable for BeamSQL
body:
This PR is dependent on https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13495 - do not merge it before this one is merged. Added integration test for Bigtable for BeamSQL and done some refactor to test utils to avoid package and classes errors in GcpApiSurfaceTest. I've tested BigtableTableIT with real Bigtable - everything seems to be working. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-7794] Enable DynamoDBIO tests (Use localstack version 0.11.4)
body:
Previously, io.aws.dynamodb.DynamoDBIOTest failed due to this issue https://github.com/localstack/localstack/issues/2702. This PR upgrades Localstack version to the one including the fix, and re-enable the tests. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Better logging for Python Docker environment
body:
As we introduce custom containers (mostly for Python), there are a couple of misleading or unclear log messages. * PortableRunner currently attempts to pull the container and ignores errors, defaulting to local images. Logging added to make this path clearer. * DockerEnvironment.default_docker_image can be called even if we don't use the default image - currently this outputs a message saying `Using default image "..."` which is very confusing. I edited to make sure it's clearer when we are using provided container image vs default container image. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11425] Metrics extraction via Monitoring API
body:
The previous contribution (https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13272) implements metrics extraction, but that works only for the universal runner, not for Dataflow runner, which requires a special implementation. This PR implements metrics extraction via Monitoring API, which will allow users to query metrics when using Dataflow. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11415] In-progress Go ValidatesRunner framework.
body:
This PR includes everything I've worked on in the Go ValidatesRunner framework so far, for initial review. Note that it includes the contents of PR #13502 as the first commit since it's a required for this code to work, but that should be reviewed in its own PR. This PR only covers the second commit. This PR creates a new subdirectory, test/validatesrunner, that is intended to just contain a bunch of tests that run and validate lightweight pipelines. It also contains a script that handles starting job servers and expansion services, similar to run_integration_tests.sh, and one initially tested gradle build rule for running it with Flink. Running with the direct runner also works fine, with the command "go test validatesrunner/... --runner=direct". Currently, the script has only been confirmed to work with Flink and the direct runner, but it should theoretically work with the Portable runner and Spark as well, once appropriate gradle build rules are figured out. Most of the contents here are likely to be transient, chances are this will be merged to be an update to the existing integration directory rather than a whole new directory, and will just replace the existing driver approach to the tests. However, this is still valuable to commit as a starting point to the work. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11415] Setup and bugfixes for Go ValidatesRunner framework.
body:
These issues were found and fixed while working on the ValidatesRunner framework, but are not directly related, so they're good candidates for a setup commit. The fixes: 1. Fixed an issue in graphx/xlang.go where the output PCollection of a composite containing an external transform wasn't being renamed properly, resulting in an error due to the composite containing a non-existent output. This was only caught when testing the Flink Runner, tests still passed with the Python Portable Runner. 2. Added a check to cross-compiling code to detect if the pipeline is being executed through go test, so an appropriate cross-compilation can be done for tests. This enables running pipelines from tests with portable runners. 3. Added a new helper function to ptest for convenience. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11408] Integrate BigQuery sink streaming inserts with GroupIntoBatches
body:
Use `GroupIntoBatches.WithShardedKey` API to group and batch write before streaming to BigQuery service. Currently batching is done best-effort on bundle finalization. This PR - adds an option to `BigQueryOptions` to toggle between the existing and new implementation; - extracts the shared code between the old and new implementation to a class `BatchedStreamingWrite` and provides an option to choose the implementation. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11374] Add key regex filter to Bigtable for BeamSQL
body:
The most natural filter for Bigtable would be `SELECT * FROM table WHERE key BETWEEN 'key0' AND 'key1'` or `WHERE key >= 'key0' AND key < 'key9'` But: `WHERE key >= 'key0' AND key < 'key4'` is not parsed as `AND(>=(key, 'key0'), <(key, 'key4'))` but as list of independent conditions: `[>=(key, 'key0'), <(key, 'key4')]` (it is required to use it together with OR to force it to be translated that way) The same with BETWEEN - `WHERE key BETWEEN 'key0' AND 'key4'` is translated to `[>=(key, 'key0'), <=(key, 'key4')]` instead of `BETWEEN(key, 'key0', 'key1')` So for now only regex filter work, as follows: `WHERE key LIKE '^key[0123]'` Other filters are not relevant to Bigtable because it doesn't allow to specify which particular cell we want to apply the filter. It could eventually be done as TBLPROPERTIES param, but I suppose that filtering by key is the most common case. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-2888]-GSoD: Script to generate data for capability matrix
body:
This work aims to automatically update the capability matrix with each project release to keep it up to date with minimum supervision or ownership. The workflow of the approach is as follows: - A script will run periodically, and using the latest runs from relevant test suites from Jenkins, it outputs a capability matrix data file in JSON format - The capability matrix file is uploaded to a public folder in GCS - The Beam website will fetch the capability matrix file every time a user loads the Capability Matrix pagefile, and build the matrix The ValidatesRunner tests of Beam validate different capabilities for each runner. Every runner has a Jenkins job which runs its ValidatesRunner test suite. Running a validate runner test indicates that the runner provides that particular capability. The current implementation fetches the different test cases which are run/not run with the status for each runner. Sample output file: https://gist.github.com/sruthiskumar/3fd6e5789ee181e6b9331534c4ebdf05 @pabloem can you please review the PR ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Avoiding queries that check whether a BQ table is empty for streaming inserts
body:
This fix will prevent BQ-related tools from issuing unnecessary queries to verify table emptiness. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). body:

This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). body:
n't match. The previous exceptions could be triggered with the stuck commit logic if the commit was not lost but just very slow. hronous and make the timeout configurable. title: [BEAM-11207] Return valid error on job failures
body:

title: Do not add unnecessary experiment use_multiple_sdk_containers.
body:
When Dataflow runs portable python pipelines, such as all Python streaming pipelines and all pipelines on Runner V2, Dataflow service currently starts as many SDK containers as there are CPU cores on the VMs. This behavior was originally initiated by the SDK setting an experiment use_multiple_sdk_containers, and it was possible to disable this behavior by supplying `--experiment=no_use_multiple_sdk_containers`. Dataflow service no longer needs SDK to supply these experiments, so we clean up this logic. Dataflow service may still recognize `--experiment=no_use_multiple_sdk_containers` for some time but it is NOT RECOMMENDED to use this knob: in the future Dataflow may have better algorithms for deciding how many SDK containers to start, and specifying this knob may interfere with these algorithms. Users can control the number of cores on the VMs by setting an appropriate `--machine_type`. Note that there are custom machine types, where users can select number of cores and number of memory GBs, such as `--machine_type=custom-1-13312-ext` which will have 1 core and 13GB memory. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10475] Add typehints for ShardedKeyCoder
body:

title: [BEAM-11392] SideInputHandlerTest: inline trivial test setup for clarity
body:
Encountered this while working on a somewhat larger change. Some things are done in shared test setup that really should not be - the setup is so trivial it doesn't save any mental space or code space - the setup is relevant only for some test cases - it actually mixes different windows in weird ways, seemingly to shoehorn all the test cases into the same test setup - the setup does not encapsulate anything meaningful; to understand a test case, it is necessary to read and remember the details of the setup. These are inlined so each test is more independently readable and has no irrelevant coupling. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11391] Improve Nexmark Kafka support to track
body:
watermarks using commit time, allow specifying the number of partitions instead of requiring launcher to have access to kafka cluster, and removing unneeded deserialization of keys. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11385] Supress keyfor for KeyedTimerData in Samza
body:
Error occurs when building java. Not occuring on master, but no clear fix in master either. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Make checkstyle suppression filepath absolute
body:
Without this `./gradlew sdks:java:build-tools:checkstyleMain` fails with a FileNotFoundException when run with Java 11. It looks for suppression.xml in the daemon directory (see https://github.com/gradle/gradle/issues/8286). title: [BEAM-11383] Add runtime normalization for file timestamps
body:
This normalizes the sdk.properties file which has a build timestamp in it as well as the version and sdk version. For the purposes of the runtime classpath, these can be ignored so that tasks are not rerun if only the build timestamp is changed. This should result in significantly higher cache hits as well as more up-to-date checks. This also preserves timestamps for certain tasks for the same reason. BEAM-11383 Read the [Gradle release notes](https://docs.gradle.org/6.6/release-notes.html#performance-improvements) for an explanation of runtime classpath normalization. Read the header "Improved cache hits with normalized runtime classpaths". Below is an example of a task that would be avoided when the sdk.properties file does not change: ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10911] Grafana post-commit status board: job_name cells now link to corresponding Jenkins job.
body:
This is a minor improvement to the Grafana Post-Commits status dashboard. Cells in the "Job Name" column now link to the appropriate Jenkins page at https://ci-beam.apache.org ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X] @tvalentyn - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Add tests for hbase with client 2.x
body:
Add the module to test `HBaseIO` for provided client ver 2.3.3 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11375] Downgrade Kafka clients dependency to fix spark postcommit
body:
PR https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13026 has broken Spark postcommit because of Kafka dependencies mismatch. Starting with Kafka clients 2.5.0 Scala 2.11 is no longer supported. This PR reverts Kafka client to 2.4.1 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-12530] Make FakePandasObject handle inline pandas objects
body:
This modifies FakePandasObject to handle cases like `pd.DataFrame({'col': pd.Series(..)})`. Previously the `pd.Series` would be replaced with a DeferredSeries and passed to `pd.DataFrame`. With this change we identify DeferredBase instances in the args and replace them with their original value. Note that this effectively duplicates the inline object in the input_env. I considered creating a computed expression that refers to the original instead, but this seems overly complicated for little benefit. This fixes a few cases in the user guide. Before: ``` 882 failed (17.7%) 2432 passed (48.8%) ``` After: ``` 868 failed (17.4%) 2498 passed (50.1%) ``` Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-10641] Add Combiner Packing to Dataflow
body:
This change adds the combiner packing pipeline optimization added by [BEAM-10409](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10409) to DataflowRunner. DataflowRunner now runs the optimizer on the pipeline proto before it is sent to Dataflow. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [release-2.26.0][BEAM-11214] Exclude more KuduIO from checker since it crashes under Java 11 which
body:
our nightly is running Cherry pick of https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13300/commits which also affects the release branch. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10986] Update shadow jar plugin.
body:
This updates the shadow jar plugin to the latest version. The new version removes the dependency on the shadowjar task from the build task. This would cause the shadow jar not to be built in certain cases. See [BEAM-10986] for more info. The latest version of the shadow jar plugin uses the latest gradle apis to take advantage of the build cache. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11376] Ignoring DicomIOReadIT
body:
PR https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13137 caused Post-commit to break because of DicomIOReadIT. Ignoring the test while fixing. Tracked using https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11376 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11365] Direct Runner: Handle pipeline option string quotes under windows os
body:
r: @TobKed Manually tested direct runner on both windows 10 and ubuntu. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9187] Address flake in loadBalancesBundles
body:
See my comment on BEAM-9187 for an explanation of what seems to have caused the flakes: > It seems that, in the error case, what's happening is as soon as the forked thread releases the semaphore [here](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/5e9237cd425da92a98536ba598a6217c21b31286/runners/java-fn-execution/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/fnexecution/control/DefaultJobBundleFactory.java#L560), the main thread continues, [creating the bundle](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/5e9237cd425da92a98536ba598a6217c21b31286/runners/java-fn-execution/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/runners/fnexecution/control/DefaultJobBundleFactoryTest.java#L478), and then making the assertions. However since we left the forked thread, it never got out of the b2.close() call and [set the boolean](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/5e9237cd425da92a98536ba598a6217c21b31286/runners/java-fn-execution/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/runners/fnexecution/control/DefaultJobBundleFactoryTest.java#L470). This PR addresses it by replacing the `TimerTask` and `AtomicBoolean` with a `ScheduledFuture`. We then make an assertion on the result of the scheduled future, including a small delay to make sure the main thread will block and give the forked thread a chance to run. Remaining work on BEAM-11200 is to include a go file in the updates so this happens as part of the cut process. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11363] Create `:sdks:java:extensions:ml:integrationTest` target, run in Java PostCommit
body:
Instead of running IT classes in the `:test` task, this PR runs them in a separate `:integrationTest` task, which is run by the Java PostCommit. title: [BEAM-11361] Dynamic splitting of SDF IOs.
body:
For now, only json lines are supported. CSV files are more complicated. This is based on top of https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13431 as well. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Handle mark expiration for blobs in azure
body:
On occasion, and for large files, it may happen that file marks expire on the service side on Blobstore. This change handles that specific occurrence by reopening the file whenever the mark is expired, and jumping to the appropriate position. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-11358] Remove unused endOfStreamMonitor from nexmark and remove redundant distributions from monitor
body:
The `endOfStreamMonitor` in the `NexmarkQuery` class is not used. The monitor class also had start and end distributions, which used the same values. This PR removes the unused monitor and merges the start and end distributions. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [X] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [X] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11355] Fix topological ordering of pipeline_from_stages after sort_stages
body:
Under some conditions, `translations.pipeline_from_stages()` after `translations.sort_stages()` could return a pipeline that was not topologically sorted due the construction of the tree of parents to subtransforms. This change ensures that the pipeline is topologically ordered by ensuring that when a transform is added to the pipeline, each of its ancestors become the last subtransform of its parent. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Add start_times to MonitoringInfos and populate them in the python SDK
body:
Add start_times to MonitoringInfos and populate them in the python SDK Start time indicates when the first value was populated by the SDK Harness. This is needed by some external metric aggregation services to indicate when the reporter of the metric first began collecting the cumulative value for the timeseries. If the SDK Harness restarts, it should reset the start_time, and reset the collection of cumulative metrics (i.e. start to count again from 0). HarnessMonitoringInfos should set this start_time once, when the MonitoringInfo is first reported. ProcessBundle MonitoringInfos should set a start_time for each bundle. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9980] use ALL_SUPPORTED_VERSIONS for constant SUPPORTED_CONTAINER_TASKS for python

followup for https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/13393#discussion_r529135483 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Advance the chromedriver-binary version with new screenshots.
body:
The stable chrome version is now 87. Also, with this version of chrome browser + chrome driver, the view port width input 1024 px will result in a screenshot with width of 1040 px. Tested it out with other values, turns out there is an additional 16px width increment when taking the screenshot. ---------------- Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Rewrite container docs for custom containers
body:
This rewrites the container guide as we move to launch custom containers for Dataflow runner. There are two methods that should be highlighted - one is using the released Dockerhub images as a base image, and one is building from Beam source itself. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10278] Move pipeline jar tests from job server projects to pyth
body:
on/test-suites/portable. This is part 1 of 2. Part 2 will move the cross language tests and close out the ticket. Now the JavaJarCreator task is shared between runners, as it always should have been. I moved test_flink_uber_jar.sh into `runners/portability` because I eventually intend to share it with Spark. I created BEAM-11333 as a follow up item, since `portable/common.gradle` is hard-coded to use Flink 1.10, which is no longer the most recent. R: @TheNeuralBit ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11337] Make the ThriftCoder class visible from outside its package
body:
The `ThriftCoder` class is currently only visible in the `thrift` package, to be used by `ThriftIO`, which is only meant to handle files.

However, this class can also be useful when consuming/producing thrift data from/to other sources/sinks, such as Kafka topics and alike.
